alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 10:48AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Keokuk, northwestern Johnson, southern Benton, northwestern Washington, southwestern Linn and Iowa Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1046 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Keystone to 6 miles southwest of What Cheer. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain with rates up to 1 to 2 inches per hour. Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Van Horne and Keystone around 1050 AM CDT. Newhall around 1100 AM CDT. Sigourney and Keswick around 1105 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Atkins, Shellsburg, Palo, South English, Cedar Rapids, Harper, Toddville, Hiawatha, Robins, Kinross and Marion. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 205 and 235. Interstate 380 between mile markers 9 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Washington
